<<<api>>>: ApplicationInfo.loadIcon
<<<code>>>: The OutOfMemoryError occurs when the device runs out of memory while trying to load the app icon. To avoid this error, you can try the following solutions:
1. Use a smaller resolution icon: Instead of loading the full resolution icon, you can use a smaller resolution icon to reduce memory usage. You can use the BitmapFactory.Options class to decode the icon with a lower sample size.
2. Use a cache: Instead of loading the icon every time the dialog is displayed, you can cache the icons in memory or on disk. This way, you only need to load the icon once and reuse it when needed.
3. Load icons asynchronously: Instead of loading all the icons at once, you can load them asynchronously in the background. This way, the UI thread will not be blocked and the app will have more memory available.
4. Limit the number of icons loaded: If you have a large number of installed apps, you can limit the number of icons loaded at a time. You can load the icons in batches or only load the icons for the visible apps in the dialog.
5. Use a library: There are libraries available that can help you handle loading and caching of app icons, such as Picasso or Glide. These libraries can handle memory management and provide additional features like placeholder images and image transformations.
<<<explanation>>>: The OutOfMemoryError occurs when the device runs out of memory while trying to load the app icon. To avoid this error, you can try the solutions mentioned above.
